question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [u16 overflow in multiplication] When parser_task_count and parser_batch_size are multiplied to calculate total transactions to process, can u16 × u16 overflow u32 bounds causing truncation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [String memory leak] Are the String values in Backup/Restore variants properly dropped when mode changes, or can repeated mode switching cause memory leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [PartialEq implementation] Does the derived PartialEq correctly compare bucket name strings in case-sensitive manner, or can 'Bucket' and 'bucket' be treated as different causing duplicate backups? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Trait: Clone] [Clone performance] Does cloning IndexerTableInfoConfig with large bucket name strings cause performance issues when passed between threads, potentially creating backpressure in config updates? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Snapshot timing attack] In Backup mode, can parser_batch_size be set to cause snapshots to be taken at incorrect epoch boundaries in snapshot_indexer_async_v2() calls, creating incomplete backups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Epoch span calculation] Can parser_batch_size values cause batches to span multiple epochs, triggering excessive snapshot operations in the backup loop (table_info_service.rs:124-166)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Backup] [Backup interval manipulation] Can rapid epoch changes combined with small parser_batch_size cause backup_snapshot_if_present() to be called too frequently, filling up GCS storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Snapshot directory collision] Can multiple nodes backing up to the same GCS bucket with identical chain_id cause snapshot filename collisions in snapshot_folder_name(), overwriting each other's backups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Invalid config recovery] If parser_task_count or parser_batch_size contain invalid values after deserialization, does the service fail gracefully or panic, potentially bringing down the entire node? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [GCS failure handling] If Backup mode is enabled but GCS is unreachable, does the indexer service continue processing or block indefinitely in backup_snapshot_if_present() loop? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Partial batch failure] If parser_task_count tasks are spawned but some fail in process_transactions_in_parallel(), can this leave the indexer in an inconsistent state with partially processed batches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Mode mismatch detection] If a node is started in Restore mode but the bucket contains no snapshots, does it fail safely or attempt to index from genesis causing massive resource usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Intentional slowdown] Can an attacker with config access set parser_task_count=1 and parser_batch_size=1 to intentionally slow down indexing by 20,000x (vs default 20×1000), causing nodes to fall behind? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [CPU exhaustion] Can parser_task_count be set to exceed the number of CPU cores, causing excessive context switching and CPU thrashing that impacts consensus performance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Database query amplification] Can high parser_task_count cause too many concurrent database queries in fetch_raw_txns_with_retries(), amplifying load and causing query timeouts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Const: DEFAULT_PARSER_BATCH_SIZE] [Batch size explosion] Can transactions with extremely large write sets combined with DEFAULT_PARSER_BATCH_SIZE=1000 cause memory explosions when all are loaded simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Bucket name propagation] If different nodes use different bucket names in Backup mode, can this lead to fragmented backups where no single location has complete chain history? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Config version skew] If validators run with different parser_task_count/parser_batch_size values, can this cause them to process transactions at different rates, leading to state desynchronization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Restore source confusion] Can an attacker trick nodes into restoring from a malicious bucket by manipulating DNS or GCS bucket resolution, loading compromised snapshots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Backup] [Snapshot integrity] Are snapshots backed up to GCS cryptographically signed or checksummed, or can an attacker modify snapshots in the bucket without detection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Restore] [Snapshot authentication] Does Restore mode verify snapshot authenticity and integrity before applying them, or can malicious snapshots be restored causing state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Configuration integrity] Is IndexerTableInfoConfig protected by signatures or checksums to prevent tampering, or can an attacker modify config files to change indexer behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Batch boundary alignment] Can parser_batch_size create misaligned batch boundaries that cause the last transaction in an epoch to be skipped or processed twice during epoch transitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Version wraparound] If ledger versions approach u64::MAX, can parser_batch_size calculations overflow in get_batches() arithmetic (table_info_service.rs:374-377), causing version wraparound? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Mode enumeration exhaustion] Does is_enabled() handle all enum variants correctly with matches! macro, or can future enum additions break the logic if not updated? (Low)
